content: hey crafters welcome to the dance craft I'm DM Scotty today I'm going to talk
about the contest that we had recently I had on my website if you don't know
contest that where I would make the winner a dungeon and our lucky winner AJ
from our forum won and he submitted a really cool to me and what I'm
going to do is I'm going to show you his neat map talk a little bit about his
descriptions and then show you the basic pieces I've cut that are ready to go so
these are just very basic pieces all the shapes of the rooms and halls and then
we'll as the bids continue I will actually paint them up and we'll talk
more about the construction of the pieces so right now let's go to the
description and then we will show the pieces hey guys here is a AJ's crypt of
the long-dead pretty neat-looking dungeon and here's some backstory to the
dungeon also if you're a player at AJ's table you better get out of here you're
gonna be in trouble alright so the players have actually
visited this location before and it's a limestone cave they had gotten across
this ravine with floating rocks and we're fighting some spiders at the
entrance when one of the players had a bright idea to light the spiderwebs
which would have been good unfortunately us it awoke something in the in the in
the crypt and the energy from the flames was sucked in turned green the fire
turned green was sucked in and then this billowing smoke came out shooting out of
the cave a wave of fear also filled the adventurers as they fled and one of the
adventurers had a vision of this ancient evil that had been awakened had baleful
green flames and a sized green flame from its in its rib kit with blackened
rib cage the lizard the local lizard tribes are weary of the place and
they tell anyone to keep away and they should not disturb it better left better
left unturned this stone and there are basically no writings or knowledge of
this ancient evil as it has been so long that anything that would have survived
is lost nightmare cliffs and wards cover the
ancient basalt stones inside and so woe to those who would venture into this
crypt so I like the idea that AJ had that there they ran into they woke
something it's their fault so they did it
so at some point the adventurers are probably going to come back here but
they're too low in their adventuring careers to actually face this thing
right now so I thought that was a really cool idea and so let's go to the table
launch I've cut all the basic shapes for the dungeon so let's go to the table and
I'll show you what I got here's the basic layout of the first floor and I've
got the cavern section that leads into the crypt itself and you see it's kind
of curved there would be a lot more as that and then it comes into like a
dungeon section here now there's a circular there's gonna be a well on the
center here and that we applied later for the circle I just used a plate I
just found a actually a bowl it was the appropriate size and I just put it in
the center there and drew a circle and cut it out and this is just basically a
strip now these rooms are an interest definitely an interesting shape and when
I got to make sure they were the same shape what I did was when I cut one I
just traced it onto the cardboard and did the other room so that was how I did
that also these rooms have a secret door that goes back up to the main hall
you'll notice that the top is missing I'm gonna have more little bit more hall
that connects to the circular stairway at the end which I don't have complete
yet but that will be there now I decided with these thin hallways there's
basically going to be an inch wide that to give it strength I'm going to just
keep probably keep the block part of it in there that way I'll still have the
walls going around but I'll keep the block just
one block piece just so that it's sturdy and I'll show you more how I do that
later so now that's the first floor so let's go ahead and I'll show you the
second floor this may look like all one mass but of course it's not now here's
the hallway now this end of the hallway will have this the circular stairway
that comes from the first floor up to this floor and then that's a hallway
there also will be a well in the center here about where the other well was and
you can see i've got the two side rooms the main room and then the end way now i
have a little mark here to line these up now all the different ations are the
walls will will help differentiate some of these the differences between the
tiles also one thing i didn't mention on the first floor there's some little
alcoves you'll notice on the map itself and i was going to put those on and
after i do the walls and i'll talk about how they how i did those so now for this
piece it's hard to find the circular piece that will exactly fit on something
this big or to the exact size you need so generally what I do is I'll just cut
it as a rectangle and then I will kind of draw you know the circular shape
until I'm quite happy with it and then cut it out in a circle like that you
know if you had there are other ways to do it you can use compasses with a
string and pencil on it but by the time I was get all that set up I can just
draw freehand so I basically just drew that freehand I just did the rectangle
and then I just drew the circular part on it and you can kind of Judge you have
it you have it touch the tip of the cardboard here and you can kind of Judge
as you how'd you do the circular piece but so that's this is the second floor
and the next for this project I will put all the walls on I of course do these
spiral stairways and then I'll talk about some
auditions to the dungeon that are just beyond the initial construction such as
some doors and as a cool acid lake that's it that's in this thing and a few
other bits and bobs so alright next time I see you I will have the walls on and
we'll talk some more about this cool crypt hey crafters I hope you've enjoyed
this episode of the DMS craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons of other
videos as you can see I am the originator of the 2.5 D method of
crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap terrain for the table if all this
intrigues you make sure you check out all the videos below also join my forum
we have lots of great crafters on there who give advice I have a link above and
below and last but not least remember go forth and craft
